intro: Caccinia strigosa, commonly known as the rough caccinia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, oval leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. Caccinia strigosa is often found in coastal regions and sandy soils, adapting well to saline environments.
